thread.title: Senate committee approves fetal tissue research ban
thread.title_full: Senate committee approves fetal tissue research ban

title: Senate committee approves fetal tissue research ban
text:
Tune in to our newscasts streaming live at the following times: 
News 3 This Morning: Weekdays 4:30 a.m.-7 a.m.News 3 at Noon: Weekdays at NoonLive at Five: Weekdays at 5 p.m.-5:30 p.m.News 3 at 5:30: Sun. at 5:30â€¦ Senate committee approves fetal tissue research ban Published On: Oct 13 2015 04:46:40 PM CDT Updated On: Oct 13 2015 09:03:06 PM CDT 
A BAN ON RESEARCH USING ABORTED FETAL TISSUE. 
IS ALSO MOVING FORWARD. 
POLITICAL REPORTER JESSICA ARP IS LIVE AT THE CAPITOL 
WITH THE LATEST. 
THIS BILL HAS RAISED CONCERNS AMONG THE U-W AND BIOTECH 
COMPANIES FOR BANNING RESEARCH THEY SAY COULD SAVE 
LIVES... 
SPARKING EFFORTS INSIDE THE CAPITOL TO AMEND THE 
BILL TO ALLOW RESEARCH. 
BUT... THAT BILL... BANNING FETAL TISSUE RESEARCH 
AND MAKING IT A FELONY TO DO SO... PASSED A SENATE 
COMMITTEE TODAY *WITHOUT* ANY CHANGES... 
SENDING IT FORWARD TO THE FULL SENATE FOR CONSIDERATON. 
DEMOCRATS DID OFFER AN AMENDMENT TO THE MEASURE EXEMPTING 
RESEARCH... 
WHICH WAS REJECTED BY THE REPUBLICANS ON THE COMMITTEE. MADISON, Wis. - 
The state Senate's health committee has approved a bill that would outlaw research using tissue obtained from aborted fetuses. Related Content GAB leader: Question about friendship 'right out of the McCarthy era' 
The Republican-controlled committee passed the bill 3-2 along party lines Tuesday. The votes clear the way for a vote in the full Senate. It's unclear how much support the bill has in that chamber, however. 
University of Wisconsin-Madison researchers and private scientists oppose the measure. They argue it could end ground-breaking medical research that relies on fetal tissue cells. Republicans have amended the bill to outlaw research on fetal tissue cell lines obtained from abortions after Jan. 1 of this year, but the researchers say they need new lines. 
The state's largest business group, Wisconsin Manufacturers and Commerce, also opposes the measure. 
Copyright 2015 The Associated Press.
